cui_name: Systemic Sclerosis associated Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension
reasoning: PAH associated with systemic sclerosis (SSc-PAH) is a serious complication of connective tissue disease. Systemic sclerosis affects ~50-300 per 100k. PAH develops in 8-12% of SSc patients. Estimated incidence of SSc-PAH ~0.8 per 100k, with prevalence among SSc patients ~2-3%. Higher mortality and morbidity than idiopathic PAH.
source: Coghlan JG et al. (2009). Pulmonary hypertension associated with connective tissue disease: the EuPHTEA registry. Eur Respir J. 33(3):535-543
